page.title: 08RELIGION
page.content:
about the prejudice and discrimination practised by the Protestant side, such as the local bank that for years refused to employ RCs until the local bishop threatened a withdrawal of savings by the Catholic population.
In Townhead, as elsewhere locally, the primary schools are religiously segregated, with Townhead primary the state non-denominational school, and St. Bartholomew's the RC primary.
In spite of this many schoolchildren in the Townhead area have friends of the 'other' denomination, and here as elsewhere in Scotland the number of mixed marriages is growing.
